intro: Diaphananthe letouzeyi, commonly known as the Madagascar starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
